answers.answer: Standing will make the swelling worse. You should sit when you get home and put your feet up. Also lots of water and protein will help the swelling. But it sounds like you should be tested for preeclampsia soon.

Your right to worry.  They can put you on a low dose of blood pressure meds to help you.  My close friend lost her first baby because of high bp.  Its recommended to check bp daily if you have high bp.  150/90 is considered very high and worrisome.  I ha e hot flashes and edema in my legs. I'm taking a low dose bp medication.

I still check it even if they tell me not to but i feel like i cannot do anything. Everytime i see them each give me a different solution i see one of the doctors today but i dont know anymore what to say to them.

question: Im 22 weeks pregnant, and i have beeing feeling hot flashes, and some swelling but when i saw my doctor he told me i needed to stop checking my blood pressure and wait until 28 weeks or so... i see different doctors at the practice where i go, my mom had preclamsia and im VERY WORRRIED seems like they give me the round around. I work standing up and im not sure if that can make it worse... any suggestions??
title: 22 Weeks and blood pressure of 152/74
